content: I have to say, I expect better from a site which has the nerve to pop malware ads up on me. The author of that comic seems to have taken the "quirky" in "quirky internet humour" to mean "stupid" (a mistake far too many webcomic artists make, sadly).

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Yeah, me neither.

I like its stupid and simple humor, one panel jokes instead of the long tedius stories and in-jokes you see in webcomics today.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Yes but...
Most of the jokes fall short or very far more often than not... from being FUNNY. It's like... makes you chuckle and go "Yeaaaaahhh..." No you want to see how one panel hahas are done? Go talk to Larson. He's the expert.

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Sadly, Larson is dead.

(Well, maybe not, but he should've died when his comic did; you just can't do anything more in life after making that.)

Still C&H is a reasonable effort for a web comic; I'm not saying it's awesome, but I will say it beats Peanuts and Garfield combined.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Gary Larson managed to create his own "type" of comic, and perhaps because of the sheer quantity in which he produced it more than the quality (hey, it worked for Beethoven too - but I'm not saying that either are crap) it had a big impact on comics. The Far Side was a big explosion, and the crappy stylistic knock-offs that litter the internet are just echoes, and echoes of echoes. And who wants to listen to echoes? Bats, that's who. And possibly sea mammals. Are we sea mammals? No. We may or may not have evolved from aquatic apes, but we do not naturally use echolocation. Metaphorically, I mean. Well. Good to see that B&S is back up again!

*sidles to the fire escape and dashes off*----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Well, I'd have to say that a lot of Larson's comics are the comic equivalent of animutations; cheap, nasty and senseless, yet somehow strangely addictive. (I suspect both have been spiked with visual heroin.)

So... do we get a *second* BS, or is it only one per month?
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: It is official.
content:
Once a month only. And if find that Galaxieretter has missed an update one month, we may assume that he's pregnant. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!
